description.narrative: (Uganda): .The Regional Health Integration to Enhance Services activity in South West Uganda (RHITES-SW) supports 256 maternal, neonatal and child health (MNCH) sites and 255 TB management units in 16 districts. RHITES-SW supports implementation of a district-based integrated package of quality Maternal Child Health, Family Planning, HIV/AIDS, Tuberculosis, nutrition, malaria, and WASH interventions in targeted districts. Three main areas will be prioritized: scaling-up and strengthening implementation of high impact, evidence-based packages; strengthening community-level interventions to increase demand and uptake of MNCH family planning services; and strengthening the health system to improve MNCH and family planning services. ..Major activities include, but are not limited to: capacity building using on-the-job training and mentorship; promoting evidence-based decision-making at district, facility and community level; leveraging other health and non-health platforms to increase coverage and diversify audiences, targeting young people and women groups; strengthening supply chain management at facility level for effective use of commodities; and improving quality of care through application of continuous quality improvement. RHITES-SW will support communities to identify and address structural, social and patient-related barriers to seeking health care. RHITES-SW will engage key stakeholders including religious and cultural leaders to create a supportive and enabling environment for quality health care services and to support better health seeking behaviors among the target population. RHITES-SW will contribute to self-reliance in the region through its district-based approach and meaningful engagement of all stakeholders and beneficiaries. These two approaches will improve local communities' capacity to identify, plan, finance (where possible) and implement local solutions to their health challenges. .. .

title.narrative: Evaluation of USAID/Ugandas district-based technical assistance (DBTA) model as applied under strengthening tuberculosis and HIV/AIDS responses (STAR) projects in east, east-central, and south-west Uganda
Regional Health Integration to Enhance Services in South West Uganda (RHITES SW)
